page.title: 18HOUSES
page.content: Most of the houses in this area are reasonably old farmhouses as this is a largely agricultural area.In Cambridge there is a row of brick houses dating from between 1815 and 1857(some bearing commemorative plaques) for the farmworkers. Outside the village a few modern bungalows have been built. In Slimbridge most of the older houses have been pulled down and replaced by more modern two storey houses although the actual village existed before the Norman Invasion. This is proven by the Church which was built in the eleventh century. Out from Cambridge and into the surrounding countryside one comes across many old farmhouses converted into private residences.These contrast with the terraced houses in Cambridge.
